about_the_game:
A surreal, menu driven, pseudo-immersive sim without rhyme or reason.

Thoroughly pointless, obtuse and purposely unfriendly. Dog's World will not hold your hand, pat your head or pinch your cheeks. Dog's World is indifferent and uncaring.

Set in the small town of South Hope, our aging protagonist Dog is unemployed, listless and destitute. Perhaps you'll provide the positive direction he needs in his life? Perhaps not.

Dog's World is an exercise in frustration - What's the point? What am I supposed to be doing? There are ways to "win" the game - Things to do, obstacles in the way, endings to find - But you're not going to get a quest marker or a reminder of what you're supposed to be doing. There isn't any auto-pilot, map or checklists. You're just going to have to figure it out.


Dog's World features:

  • "Player Unfriendly" design philosophy
  • Obtuse game design
  • Multiple Endings
  • Fully kill-able NPCs
  • Faux Open World
  • Unpleasant atmosphere
  • Oppressive and stifling player freedom

content_descriptors.notes: Contains harsh language, depictions of death, violence, dead bodies, exaggerated gore and drug use.

name: Dog's World Demo

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS *: Windows Vista or Better
  • Processor: Intel Core 2 Quad Q8400
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTS 450 or equivalent
  • DirectX: Version 9.0
  • Storage: 2 GB available space
  • Sound Card: Onboard
  • Additional Notes: Mouse required
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • OS *: Windows 7 or better
  • Processor: Intel Core i5-3330 @ 3.00GHz or better
  • Memory: 16 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 560 Ti or better
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Storage: 2 GB available space
  • Sound Card: Onboard
  • Additional Notes: Mouse required

short_description: A surreal, menu driven, pseudo-immersive sim without rhyme or reason - What's the point? What am I supposed to be doing? Is it supposed to look like this? The answer to all these questions is yes.
